note.p: Career: Wine merchant, London (1754-1761); Spent six months in Italy where he had his portrait painted by Batoni (1762); travelled subsequently to North Africa, Crete, Syria, Egypt and eventually Abyssinia [Ethiopia]; Consul General, Algiers (1763-1765). in 1768 he journeyed to Abyssinia by the Nile, Aswan, the Red Sea and Massowah. In 1770 he reached the source of the Abbai or headstream of the Blue Nile.
Freemason, member of Lodge Canongate Kilwinning No 2, Canongate, Edinburgh
Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 'Freemasons and the Royal Society: Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' 2010 page 12 [Gives place of birth as Larbert, Falkirk]
